Articles.Content: There have been several threads about this before, but it was a while ago.
Seeing as this isn't specifically about KSP, moved to the Space Lounge.
This is actually really interesting, from a coding point of view. I assume this is generated? (With a set list of "comic strips" or sections, whatever you want to call them)

[spoiler!]

To anyone who doesn't want to zoom in a heck of a lot, there's a story arc when zooming into the turtles, there's a pixel in which Randall says "So excited about my book launch!" If you continue zooming into the book he's holding, he gets rocket parts labeled from a bin labeled KSP Rocket Parts. He builds the rocket, whereupon his wife comes up and says "Needs more struts." He adds them, and the rocket whooshes off into the wild blue yonder, and then his wife comes up again and says, "I think that was the only copy."

You're welcome, people with slow computers.

Edited October 24, 2014 by UpsilonAerospace
Making things a wee bit more clear.
Is this because of the KSP panel in it?

[spoiler!]

To anyone who doesn't want to zoom in a heck of a lot, there's a story arc when zooming into the turtles, there's a pixel in which Randall says "So excited about my book launch!" If you continue zooming into the book he's holding, he gets rocket parts labeled from a bin labeled KSP Rocket Parts. He builds the rocket, whereupon his wife comes up and says "Needs more struts." He adds them, and the rocket whooshes off into the wild blue yonder, whereupon his wife comes up and says, "I think that was the only copy."

You're welcome, people with slow computers.

Nice find.

How do you make these things?
